comments:
Create a Java Project - JP1.
Create a Java Class JCa in package Pa in JP1.
Create a Simple project - SP1

Select JCa in the Package Explorer and using the context menu select Refactor
... Move

In the Move Refactoring dialog ... select SP1 as the destination and click OK

Result: The move happens but exceptions are thrown ...
!ENTRY org.eclipse.ltk.core.refactoring 4 10000 2005-10-13 13:45:07.974
!MESSAGE Participant
org.eclipse.jst.jsp.ui.java.refactoring.JSPTypeMoveParticipant removed due to
the following exception
!STACK 0
java.lang.ClassCastException: org/eclipse/core/internal/resources/Project
incompatible with org/eclipse/jdt/core/IPackageFragment
	at
org.eclipse.jst.jsp.ui.internal.java.refactoring.JSPTypeMoveParticipant.createChange(JSPTypeMoveParticipant.java:72)
	at
org.eclipse.ltk.core.refactoring.participants.ProcessorBasedRefactoring.createChange(ProcessorBasedRefactoring.java:232)
	at
org.eclipse.ltk.core.refactoring.CreateChangeOperation.run(CreateChangeOperation.java:117)
	at
org.eclipse.ltk.core.refactoring.PerformChangeOperation.run(PerformChangeOperation.java:189)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.Workspace.run(Workspace.java:1719)
	at
org.eclipse.ltk.internal.ui.refactoring.WorkbenchRunnableAdapter.run(WorkbenchRunnableAdapter.java:86)
	at
org.eclipse.jface.operation.ModalContext$ModalContextThread.run(ModalContext.java:113)

The Move actually fails the first time. Once the error causing participant is
removed, then the move succeeds on subsequent attempts.
Looks like an error in the JSPTypeMoveParticipant

There's an unsafe casting assumption in that class. That destination project is
a Java project.  In this case the participant would probably do nothing.

This is a good testcase.
This change is a bulk update of all _un_targeted, fixed, resolved bugs upon release of M5. This particular bug _might_ have been fixed earlier than M5. (Feel free to correct).
